subject: Test method names
msgSnippet: [Mike Duffy...] ... Mike, you know I love you, buddy, but this grates me more and more I see it. ... 07 means nothing, except possibly to you. The eighth
messageBody:
[Mike Duffy...]
>I use the following naming convention for my test methods to keep
>things organized:
>
> test_##_nameOfMethodBeingTested
>
>For example, the eigth test method for the method isAccountAssigned
>would be,
>
> test_07_isAccountAssigned

Mike, you know I love you, buddy, but this grates me more and more I see it.
:)

"07" means nothing, except possibly to you. "The eighth test for method X"
is also less useful than "The test for method X that tries null parameters."
The number works great until you need 100 people to understand what's going
on. Can you replace the numbers with some meaningful words? You only have to
type it once.

Some ideas:

public void testIsNullAccountAssigned();
public void testIsAccountAssignedNullAccount();
public void testWeCanHandleNullAccounts();

Notice the last one talks more about the feature you're testing, and not the
method you're testing. This gives you more freedom to change the
implementation of the feature. Trust me: that's something you desperately
want; otherwise, refactoring is awfully slow.

JBR.
